conclusion: Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds.
Car B starts from rest and accelerates uniformly, shown as a straight line from the origin.
The slope of the v-t graph for Car B gives its acceleration as 2 m/s^2.
Position function for Car A is x_A(t) = 40t.
Position function for Car B is x_B(t) = t^2.
Cars are side by side at t = 0 s and t = 40 s.
Distance between the cars is Î”x(t) = 40t - t^2.
Maximum distance occurs at t = 20 s.
